intro: Ceratotheca sesamoides var. baoulensis, commonly known as the Baoulé sesamoid, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as riverbanks and savannas. The seeds are encased in a hard, woody capsule, which is a distinctive botanical feature of the species.
